content.description: This problem may be over in just a few moves but figuring out how to get into sequence can take some time. Stand and match on good edge then move up to top of shallow scoop. Pull through and finish.
content.protection: Bouldering Pad: Good landing, one pad.
content.location: Downhill face of Body Snap boulder, the large boulder at the bottom of Colflesh area.

content.description: Sit start low then climb little arÃªte and move right at top to finish out on easy slab.
content.protection: Bouldering Pad: Bring two pads to protect against the jumble of small rocks surrounding the start.
content.location: Uphill edge of the Body Snap boulder (large boulder at the bottom of the area). Just right of Body Snap (V4/V6).

content.description:
An area classic, one of the most tried in all of Gretna! 

  Sit start with a good undercling and a crimp. Pull up and snag the side pull, pick some feet and make crux long move out left to good crimps. Follow the crimps left up to a big sloper. Then make a tension move to the lip to a causal topout. 

  Although this is called Body Snap Sit the only move it shares with Body Snap is the top out.
content.location: Obvious low starting holds on the Body Snap Boulder.

content.description: Start on the prow of the boulder around the corner from Colflesh boulder. You'll walk across a log to get there.Start with a decent right hand and a low left hand crimp, make the first move to the pinch and move to the right hand out to an edge, from there work up to the top out.
Thin holds to slopers at the lip. Exit via an engaging mantle.
content.location: Located right of Body Snap (sit) and left of Energy.

content.description: The boulder around the corner from Colflesh boulder.
